result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Michael Johnson

records.addlTxt:
9:59 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Christopher M Johnson in court.  Attorney Nathan Steven Schnick in court for Christopher M Johnson.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

2021CM000059, 2021CM000079, 2022CM000009, 2022CM000010, 2022CM000014, 2022CM000046 called

Attorney Schnick is heard on sentencing. 
Attorney Steiner is heard on sentencing. 

Court reviews plea questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the constitutional and fundamental rights with Defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the elements of the charge with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the minimum / maximum penalties with defendant. Defendant states understanding. 

Court asks defendant for plea. Defendant enters a Guilty plea. Court accepts the defendants Guilty plea and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters plea. Court finds the defendant guilty. 

Attorney Steiner is heard on sentencing recommendations. Recommends that Sentence withheld; 2 years probation, conditions to include - absolute sobriety, testing, AODA assessment. Defendant to participate and follow through with any assessments, counseling or programming deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections. Costs - to include $240.00 Crawford County Sheriff's office for blood draw fees. Domestic battery fee. Additional conditions to include 3 months jail.

Attorney Schnick is heard on sentence. Requests a lessor sentence. Requests 18 month probation. 3 months conditional Huber/EM. Agrees to restitution. 10 days jail credit.   

Defendant is heard. 

Court orders on all 4 cases withhold sentence; 2 years probation. Conditions absolute sobriety and random testing. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages, nor enter any taverns unless approved by probation agent. AODA assessment and Domestic Violence assessment to be completed and defendant to follow through with any treatment and recommendation's. Remit the DNA surcharge for Case 21CM79, 22CM09, 22CM10.  Only 1 DNA. PP Approved. $50.00 pr mo commencing Oct 1, 2022 and thereafter. $15.00 PPF. 10 days jail credit if sent rev. 

21CM59 - 3 months of conditional county Jail (stay report to CC Jail no later than October 19th, 2022 at 6:30 PM Huber/EM approved and defendant is approved to serve jail in another county 
Restitution to KAP $1,073.21 (Jail and Restitution applies only to this case) (Domestic Violence Surcharge) 
Ct1 - 947.01(1) - Disorderly Conduct (1) (DISMISSED, READ IN)
Ct2 - 940.19(1) - Battery (1) Guilty 
Ct3 - 943.01(1) - Criminal Damage to Property (1) (DISMISSED, READ IN)

Ct1 - 947.01(1) - Disorderly Conduct (1) Guilty

Ct2 - 946.49(1)(a) - Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor (1) (DISMISSED)

22CM10 (Domestic Violence Surcharge)

9:41 AM Cases 21CM59, 21CM79, 22CM09 22CM10 22CM14 22CM46 called together- appearances stated.
 
Defendant Christopher M Johnson appeared by phone.  Attorney Nathan Steven Schnick appeared by video for Christopher M Johnson.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty. Johnson is heard on status - optimistic this matter will be resolved -can set for plea or set for one more status
Atty. Steiner ok with either
Court advises plea has not been entered in 22CM46
22CM46 -Atty Johnson is heard -  Def. stands mute
Clerk directed to enter NOT GUILTY plea in this case
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

4:21 PM Cases called by the court.  Prosecuting attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Christopher Michael Johnson appeared by video, Attorney Nathan Steven Schnick for Christopher Michael Johnson appeared by video. 
         Court informs Def. of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Def. states understanding.  Defendant stands mute.  
Case concluded at 4:25 pm.
Jury status hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Jury status hearing on April 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.
